titleStmt.title: A Call to Scotland for threatning famine, or, A discourse

notesStmt.note: "Shewing I. that not only Scotland, but the whole isle of Britain are in as dangerous a state, and as liable (by reason of the grossness of their sins) to the dreadful judgements of God, as ever the old world, Sodom, and Gommorah, or any other nation were and II. that unless we timeously repent, we can expect nothing but to be cut off from being any more a people, like the obstinat stiffnecked Jews, and scattered as vagabounds thorew the earth.
Reproduction of original in the Cambridge University Library.
